message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD

This paper deals with natural language processing and information retrieval techniques to automatically mine claims from a corpus of news articles and detect them in spoken speeches. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. The paper also involves machine learning techniques for classification and detection, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of large datasets and statistical analysis could also relate to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.SD (Sound).
